case_circumstances: Highway maintenance workers discovered body lying beneath a Palo Verde tree at Mile Post 18 along the west travel lanes of Interstate 40.  He was wearing a gray "Banana Republic" sweatshirt, tan jeans with no namebrand or size, but a button with 5 stars, a rope belt, two black and white highly worn "Voit" ankle high tennis shoes, size 12 and two white socks.  A tan winter coat was next to him a full set of chess pieces found wrapped in sleeve of the coat.  Also found were 4 multi-colored lighters, smoking tobacco, a small pair of scissors and nail clippers.  Subject had gray hair and a full gray beard.  Fingerprints were taken by MCSO with negative hits received...last known date run through FBI and AFIS is 9/8/09.  Teeth were examined and charted by Dr. Birkby at the Forensic Science Center in Tucson, AZ.  Dr. Birkby sent dental x-rays to the California DOJ in 1998.
case_clothing_on_body: Gray sweatshirt "Banana Republic", tan jeans (no namebrand or size, but a button with 5 stars), extremely worn black and white ankle high tennis shoes "Voit", a rope belt and two white socks.
case_clothing_with_body: A tan winter type jacket and a tan jacket with the sleeves cut off.
case_footwear: Size 12 "Voit" ankle high tennis shoes-extremely worn
case_other_items_with_body: A full set of chess pieces in a black plastic-material case rolled up in the winter jacket.  A small pair of scissors and nail clippers.  Four multi-colored lighters and tobacco in a tobacco bag.
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
